^xE05030>>>>>>>>>>>>>> BANDITS & PANTHEON <<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<^7^7
^xE05030Bandits^7: Kill All (^xE05030Kraiten^7 for leveling) Major God: ^xE05030Soul of Arakaali^7 (^xE05030Brine-King^7 for leveling) Minor God: ^xE05030Soul of Abberath^7 (^xE05030Ralakesh^7 for leveling)^7
^x70FF70>>>>>>>>>>>>>> SETTLERS OF KALGUUR TIPS <<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<^7
Bows will be getting a variety of new powerful and build-enabling enchant options, including ^xD02090^x70FF70Far Shot^7^7 & '^x70FF70Projectiles Return to you^7.' While it's not yet known how quickly and conveniently these enchants can be obtained, they should likely be acquirable by early endgame. Be sure to double check the suggested bow craft in the Items section for whichever build variant you're following at the time.^7
^xFFFF77^x8888FF>>>>>>>>>>>>>> ADDITIONAL LEVELING TIPS <<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<^7
There are three subsections for the leveling portion of the guide, including 'Campaign Start,' 'Early Leveling,' and 'Late Leveling.' The Skills, Items, and Passive Tree sections all contain matching templates for each of these subsections to be followed to your liking. Collectively, these encompass the segment of the game leading up to high-tier ^xE05030Red maps^7. They contain several high-power leveling ^xAF6025Uniques^7, none of which are mandatory at this stage, however. This is a ^xD02090Precise Technique^7 leveling tree, which means you must always be aware of your ^x70FF70Accuracy^7-to-^xE05030Life^7 ratio. The trajectory plotted in the guide should keep your ^xE05030Life^7 under ^x70FF70Accuracy^7 so long as you don't have an unusually high number of items with ^xE05030Life ^7rolls equipped. Leveling will begin as a conventional ^x70FF70Galvanic Arrow^7 into ^x70FF70Rain of Arrows^7 hit-based elemental setup. Prioritize flat damage ASAP and anywhere you can get it, including Iron Rings, Serrated Quiver, ^x8888FFMagic gloves^7, etc. First ^xE05030Bandit^7 kill can be whichever you like, but veteran campaign runners should opt for ^xE05030Kraiten^7 for the +8% increased movement speed. ^xFFFF77Act 2^7's sidequest ^xFFFF77The Golden Hand^7 now grants an additional passive point. The Library quest will need to be done to pick up ^xE05030Inspiration^7, ^x7070FFInnervate^7^7, and ^x7070FFFlame Dash^7. The vendor, Lilly, can give you ^x7070FFImmolate^7 as of ^xFFFF77Act 6^7. ^x70FF70Elemental Hit of the Spectrum^7 and ^xAF6025Prismweave^7 will compete for highest priority first trade purchase. It'll be best to purchase ^x70FF70Elemental Hit of the Spectrum^7 off trade sometime after ^xFFFF77Act 6 ^xC8C8C8^7and preferrably around the time when you reach ^x70FF70Master Fletcher^7 and ^x70FF70Multishot^7 on the tree. Because of all the sources of flat damage in this build, ^xAF6025Quill Rain^7 is actually a Best-in-Slot leveling bow until high-tier ^xE05030Red maps^7. It may or may not be worth pursuing depending on its price early on. Swap from ^x70FF70Haste^7 + ^xE05030Anger^7 to ^xE05030^x70FF70Haste^7^7 + ^x7070FFPurity of Elements^7 + ^x70FF70Herald of Ice^7 after finishing the campaign. Prior to acquiring ^xAF6025Lioneye's Paws^7, run ^x70FF70Sniper's Mark^7 linked to ^x70FF70^x70FF70Mark-on-Hi^x70FF70t^7^x70FF70 Support^7^7^7 instead of ^x7070FFElemental Weakness^7 linked to ^x7070FFHextouch Support^7. The ^xD02090Deadeye^7 ascendancy will be chosen for its superior speed and instant clear in low-level content. Plan to swap from ^xD02090Deadeye^7 to ^xD02090Warden^7 while completing the fourth and final lab (or sooner if you wish). The cost of this respec is unknown as ^xFFFF77Gold^7 is now a new currency for it. The ^xD02090Warden^7 ascendancy favors bossing damage more than the ^xD02090Deadeye^7. Completing 2 or even 4 Voidstones within the confines of modest leveling gear should be doable for anyone familiar with their corresponding boss mechanics.^7^7^7^7^7^7
^xADAA47^xFFFF77>>>>>>>>>>>>>> ADDITIONAL EARLY ENDGAME TIPS <<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<^7
These are the major things needed to be done before entering this stage of the build: 1) Swap from ^xD02090Deadeye^7 to ^xD02090Warden^7 and finish the fourth and final lab. 2) Reach level 90+ with ^x70FF70Spell Suppression^7 cap and high ^x70FF70Evasion^7 3) Acquire a Short/Grove/Thicket base bow with a modest triple flat elemental damage roll plus attack speed 4) Acquire the following (as of 3.24) cheap build-enhancing uniques, '^xAF6025Ahuana's Bite^7,' '^xAF6025Painseeker^7,' '^xAF6025Lioneye's Paws^7,' '^xAF6025Halcyon^7.' The other uniques are not as important. 5) Annoint ^x7070FFDefiled Forces^7 on the amulet to consistently roll Ignites and ^xADAA47Shocks^7 on enemies. 6) Craft or buy the recommended flasks with the right bases and suffixes, albeit interchangeably^7
^xAF6025>>>>>>>>>>>>>> ADDITIONAL LATE ENDGAME TIPS <<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<^7
These are the major things needed to be done before entering these stages of the build: 1) Acquire a Bone/Ivory/Spine base bow with a respectable triple flat elemental damage roll and crit plus attack speed 2) Spec out of ^xD02090Precise Technique^7 and into the many Critical Strike nodes available on the tree 3) Swap out of ^x70FF70Artillery Ballistas^7 and into a ^x70FF70Cast-on-Crit^7 ^x70FF70Manaforge Arrows^7 setup instead 5) Craft or buy the remaining endgame utility flasks with^xAF6025 Dying Sun^7 to unlock 5+ projectiles in the build 6) Get a double ^xAF6025Inspired Learning^7 setup (and subsequently a ^xAF6025Headhunter^7) to unlock the true potential of map blasting^7^x70FF70
